title: How did a row about Airbus and Boeing planes end with a tax on cheese?
text:
Scotch whisky, cheese and woollen jumpers from Britain. Welding gear, shears and biscuits from Germany. Olives and oil from Spain. Italian liqueurs, French wine, Austrian pork.

All of these goods and more face new tariffs when sold into the US, charged at 25pc.

Why?

The reason: illegal EU subsidies for Airbus.

Fifteen years of bitter arguments have seen the EU and US at each others’ throats over treatment of their national aeroplane makers.

The World Trade Organisation’s long-running arbitration found that the support for Europe’s champion manufacturer broke the rules by tilting the playing field against America’s Boeing.

As a result the US can slap tariffs on $7.5bn-worth of imports from the...
description: Scotch whisky, cheese and woollen jumpers from Britain.
